The Administration's false choice - either support their bad deal or be in favor of war in the Middle East - must be rejected categorically.
This deal is an accommodation of a regime whose President proudly walks in front of parades chanting "Death to America" & "Death to Israel".
Sanctions relief in this deal would give Iran billions to pour directly into their network of international terrorist organizations.
This deal would make Iran a globally-approved nuclear threshold state. It would put Israel in severe danger.
Deal lifts the arms embargo against Iran, the world's largest state sponsor of terror. And the more detail we learn, the worse it seems.

Cooperation between state and local officials and smart long-term planning will be required to make the needed I-25 expansion happen.
Despite incredible growth in Northern Colorado, I-25 north of Longmont looks largely the same as when it was completed in the late 1960s.
From 2000-2010, Weld & Larimer Counties grew by nearly 120k people. Greeley & Ft Collins-Loveland are among America's fastest growing areas.
At today's Northern Colorado Transportation Summit, I spoke about the need to expand North I-25 to keep up with Northern Colorado's growth.
Happy to be in Greeley for the Northern Colorado Transportation Summit today.
